question: Posted by Susan on April 16, 1999 at 22:25:48I have posted recently-but just one more hopefully quick question for you.  I recently had a GTT and everything was OK until the 3hour draw and my blood sugar dropped to 41.  My biopsy was ? of cirrhosis.  Can cirrhosis or impaired liver function cause hypoglycemia.  They said I did not have diabetes.  My doctor said I need to now eat a high protein diet.  Thanks for response in advance.Posted by Sandy RN on April 23, 1999 at 03:00:54Yes, liver dysfunction can cause hypoglycemia. Simply put,  the liver helps regulate the sugar and carbohydrates in your blood. If you have liver problems, you may have trouble with hypoglycemia. Liver disease can also lead to diabetes. Is your doc a hepatologist? Some docs would NOT advise a high protein diet, as this makes the liver work harder. You might consult a RD (registered dietician) for a good, liver-friendly, anti-hypoglycemic diet. hope this helps - SandyPosted by HFHSM.D.-D.M. on April 23, 1999 at 17:44:21Dear Susan:I appreciated your interesting questions and I
